taskbody.prereq: For silent installation, you need admin rights.

step.cmd: Open PowerShell or Command Prompt and change the directory (cd) to the location of the installer .msi file.

info.note: In Windows 10, you can access the Open PowerShell window here context menu when you shift-right-click a folder in Explorer. This allows you to open PowerShell in the current window without having to change the directory.

step.cmd: Type msiexec /i and do one of the following:

choices.choice: Type the file name of the installer (e.g. BricsCAD-V20.2.09-1-en_US(x64).msi.
Drag the installer file from the Windows Explorer dialog to the command window.

step.cmd: (option) Add ADDDESKTOPSHORTCUT="" to suppress the addition of a desktop shortcut.
(option) Add SHOWRELEASENOTES="" to suppress the display of the Release Notes when the installation completes.
(option) Add APPLICATIONFOLDER="your_app_folder" to install in a custom folder.
(option) Add BRXLICENSEDESTFILE="path_to_lic_file" to specify a folder for the license file if any of the properties BRXLICENSEKEY, BRXLICENSEFILE or BRXLICENSESERVER are defined.
(option) Add BRXLICENSEKEY="your_license_key" to activate the license and store it in the folder specified by BRXLICENSEDESTFILE.
(option) Add BRXLICENSEFILE="your_license_file" to copy the license file to the folder specified by BRXLICENSEDESTFILE.
(option) Add BRXLICENSESERVER="host", or BRXLICENSESERVER="port@host" (*) to create a license file in the folder specified by BRXLICENSEDESTFILE, containing the server host specification.
step.info: (*) If your license server is using a different port than default port 5053.

step.cmd: (option on 32-BIT only) Add INSTALLVBA="0" or INSTALLVBA="" to not install VBA.
step.info: The complete entry in the command prompt can be: msiexec /i "BricsCAD-Vxx.x.xx-x-en_US(x64).msi" /qn ADDDESKTOPSHORTCUT="" SHOWRELEASENOTES="".

step.cmd: Press Enter to launch the installation.

ul.li: For more options, type: msiexec /? at the command prompt.
On the Microsoft website, you can find more information about the msiexec command.
